poem:
**Resolutions in Red**

Red wine resolutions,  
Hana and Louis,  
two hearts in annual revel.  
Melbourne's streets—  
a tableau of timid steps,  
each month a beckon.  
Failed ventures, but  
the heart persists  
in its quest, persists  
amidst the city's hum,  
like whispered confessions  
in the night air.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "My friend and I made a resolution to ask someone out in person every month. We failed | Louis Hanson Last December, after consuming a few red wines, my friend Hana and I set ourselves the new year resolution to ask someone out in person each month. With Hana visiting Melbourne from Canberra a couple of times a year, it was typical for our boozy biannual catch-ups to end in questions about our dating lives.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: My friend and I made a resolution to ask someone out in person every month. We failed | Louis Hanson Last December, after consuming a few red wines, my friend Hana and I set ourselves the new year resolution to ask someone out in person each month. With Hana visiting Melbourne from Canberra a couple of times a year, it was typical for our boozy biannual catch-ups to end in questions about our dating lives.
